intro: Odontostemma inornatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves close to the ground. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, are adapted for pollination by insects. Odontostemma inornatum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
